result.execSummary:
The defendant John Robert Dawidziak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Robert Dawidziak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John Robert Dawidziak was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Robert Dawidziak

records.addlTxt: to reimburse Atty fees s/BNB/3-5-18
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant John Robert Dawidziak in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an amended criminal complaint was filed this morning to remove the domestic abuse enhancers.  
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1, D/C 947.01.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Johnson agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the amended criminal complaint.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1, Disorderly Conduct 947.01:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on April 1, 2018
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 7, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Return date on January 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant John Robert Dawidziak by phone.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court has reviewed the request by defendant to continue the jury trial on 11/10/16.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant states he needs more time to prepare for the jury trial with respect to subpoenas, etc.  Defendant would still like to continue without counsel.
Atty Hendee responds and states his concerns with defendant continuing without counsel.  Makes statement as to previously held pretrials.
BY THE COURT:  Court is concerned with defendant continuing without counsel.  Questions whether defendant would be able to fill out a financial disclosure.  Defendant states he would do that and accept a court appointed attorney.
Court will appoint counsel and remove the matter from the jury trial calendar.  Court will appoint Erik Johnson and he will be in contact with the defendant.  Court will set a new Return date and defendant needs to appear for that.
**Clerk to mail a financial disclosure to defendant and he is to return it to the Court within 7 days.  Return date scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
